bets.reasoning: Phoenix's 17-6 home record against Clippers' dismal 9-16 road record creates a significant venue edge. The 6-1 recent H2H record and +3.5 net rating differential provide strong statistical backing. While Clippers are 8-2 L10, their road struggles and missing ~24% of offense with Jones Jr./Bogdanovic limited tips the balance clearly to Phoenix at home.
bets.primary_edge: Phoenix 17-6 home vs Clippers 9-16 road combined with 6-1 recent H2H dominance
bets.reflection: The 24-point blowout wasn't variance - we overweighted historical H2H and home/road splits while underweighting the Clippers' surging form. A team going 8-2 in their last 10 with clear momentum deserved more respect than season-long road struggles.

bets.reasoning: Cleveland's nearly 5-point net rating advantage (+2.19 vs -2.58) is substantial. Portland's 4-game losing streak and 0-2 home record vs Cleveland in H2H history provide additional confidence. Cleveland's 4th quarter strength (+2.8 avg in H2H) suggests they close games well. Garland concerns are noted but Mitchell's 28.2 PPG provides reliable scoring.
bets.primary_edge: ~5 point net rating differential with Cleveland 7-3 L10 vs Portland on 4-game skid
bets.reflection: The primary edge was spot-on - Cleveland's superior net rating and Portland's losing streak played out exactly as expected, with the 19-point margin exceeding even our projections. Process was sound; the medium confidence was perhaps too conservative given the clear statistical separation.

bets.matchup: Los Angeles Lakers @ New York Knicks
bets.reasoning: Knicks' 19-6 home record and +6.3 net rating differential are compelling, but Lakers' 3-1 H2H record (2-0 at MSG) creates real concern. The deciding factor is Lakers' significant availability issues - LeBron (57% games), Reaves (51%), Vincent (58%) representing 29% offensive impact. Knicks' 5-game win streak with dominant margins (+26 avg) shows current form. Lower confidence due to H2H pattern.
bets.primary_edge: Knicks elite 19-6 home record + Lakers major availability concerns offset concerning H2H history
bets.final_score: Los Angeles Lakers 100 @ New York Knicks 112
bets.reflection: The primary edge held - Knicks' home dominance and Lakers' availability issues proved decisive despite concerning H2H history. The 12-point margin validated our read on the situational factors, and appropriately sizing down due to H2H uncertainty was the right call.

bets.reasoning: Minnesota has a dominant +7.3 net rating advantage, is on a 4-game win streak, and just beat Memphis by 17 points at this same venue 2 days ago. Memphis is in complete freefall with a 5-game losing streak, 2-8 L10 record, and significant injury concerns with Morant and Edey. The Grizzlies' poor 9-15 home record diminishes any home court edge.
bets.reflection: The ratings edge was real but we overweighted the recent H2H result without accounting for the revenge game dynamic and Minnesota's potential complacency. Memphis scoring 137 points suggests they came out with maximum effort while Minnesota may have taken their foot off the gas.

bets.reasoning: Houston's elite +6.37 net rating vs Indiana's -7.74 creates a 14.1 point differential - one of the largest mismatches on the slate. Indiana's poor 10-16 home record significantly diminishes their home court advantage. Houston is 7-3 in L10 with quality wins while Indiana's recent OKC upset doesn't offset their overall struggles.
bets.reflection: The 14-point net rating edge we identified played out almost exactly as expected - Houston won outright by 4 as a +4.5 dog. Indiana's weak home record (10-16) proved to be a reliable indicator that their home court advantage was minimal.

bets.reasoning: Both teams are on the second game of a back-to-back, creating significant fatigue. H2H history shows these teams average only 215.8 points per game together. Recent scoring trends show -18.6 combined below season averages. The 224.5 line is inflated relative to the expected total of ~218.
bets.reflection: The fatigue edge was even stronger than anticipated - 197 total crushed the 224.5 line by 27.5 points. Process was solid: we identified multiple converging factors (B2B fatigue, H2H history, recent scoring trends) that all pointed the same direction.

bets.reasoning: Massive 15+ net rating differential between elite team and conference bottom-feeder. Knicks on 5-game win streak averaging +17.6 margin. Wizards 2-8 L10, 8-16 at home with worst defense in conference (116.9 DRTG). H2H dominance at 6-2 with 9.1 avg margin. This is the clearest mismatch on the slate.
bets.reflection: The ratings edge was completely validated with a 31-point blowout exceeding even our bullish expectations. This was textbook mismatch identification - elite offense vs. worst defense, strong H2H history, and clear momentum differential all aligned perfectly.

bets.reasoning: Massive 16-point net rating differential, 7-2 H2H dominance, Knicks on 5-game win streak with dominant margins. Just beat Wizards by 31 two days ago. Despite B2B concerns, talent gap is too large - Wizards are 3-7 L10 and 9-17 at home.
bets.reflection: The ratings edge was completely valid - Knicks won by exactly 31 points again, matching their previous margin. This was a textbook case of identifying a massive talent disparity that overwhelmed any situational concerns.

bets.reasoning: Pacers resting entire rotation (Siakam, Haliburton, Nembhard, Mathurin, Nesmith, McConnell all OUT). Jazz have Markkanen (26.6 PPG) and Collier who just had 22-assist game. Jazz won this exact matchup 131-122 yesterday with similar rosters.
bets.reflection: The injury edge was textbook valid - Pacers missing 6 rotation players created a massive talent gap. Jazz won by exactly 9 points, matching yesterday's result almost identically, confirming the edge was correctly sized.

bets.reasoning: Both teams missing massive offensive firepower - Curry (26.4 PPG), Butler (season), Kuminga for Warriors; Embiid (25.7 PPG), George (suspended) for 76ers. Combined ~88 PPG absent. Recent H2H was 207 total. Role player vs role player matchup should suppress scoring.
bets.reflection: The injury impact edge was spot-on - 207 total came in well under 224.5 as expected when ~88 PPG of combined offensive firepower was absent. Process was sound; this is exactly the type of injury-driven under we should continue targeting.

bets.matchup: Oklahoma City Thunder @ San Antonio Spurs
bets.reasoning: OKC is catastrophically depleted - missing SGA, Holmgren, Williams, Hartenstein, Dort, Caruso, and Mitchell. This is a G-League roster on B2B after losing by 10 to this same Spurs team yesterday. Wembanyama healthy at home is a massive mismatch. Our injury_edge bets are 2-0.
bets.final_score: Oklahoma City Thunder 106 @ San Antonio Spurs 116
bets.reflection: The injury edge was textbook valid - OKC's depleted roster on a B2B couldn't compete with a healthy Wembanyama at home, losing by exactly 10 again. Our injury_edge bets are now 3-0, confirming this as our most reliable edge type.

bets.reasoning: Jokic OUT is catastrophic for Denver - losing 27.8 PPG, 10 APG and their entire offensive identity. Combined with Gordon/Watson/Johnson out, Nuggets fielding skeleton crew. Knicks 20-6 at home, 8-game win streak, 4-1 H2H with +13.8 avg margin.
bets.reflection: The injury edge was real - Knicks won by 7 as expected in a high-scoring game. Lost by the hook (0.5 points) despite correct read on game direction; the 7.5 line was slightly inflated.

bets.reasoning: Celtics decimated - missing Tatum (out), Brown (doubtful), Hauser, Simons (traded), Boucher. Houston 17-4 at home with 4th-ranked defense facing what amounts to a developmental squad. Clear personnel mismatch.
bets.reflection: The injury edge was real but we overestimated its impact - Boston's system and depth players delivered a 21-point road win despite missing their stars. Houston laying big numbers at home has been inconsistent, and we should have recognized that elite organizations often have 'next man up' cultures that mitigate personnel losses.
